name: useAcceptDirectListingOffer
summary: Accept an offer on a direct listing from an offeror, will accept the latest offer by the given offeror.

name: useActiveListings
summary: Use this to get a list active listings from your marketplace contract.

examples.javascript: const { data: listings, isLoading, error } = useActiveListings(<YourMarketplaceContractInstance>, { seller: "0x...", tokenContract: "0x...", tokenId: 1, start: 0, count: 100 });

name: useAddress
summary:
Hook for accessing the address of the connected wallet
```javascript
import { useAddress } from "@web3sdks/react"
```

name: useAuctionWinner
summary: Use this to get the winner of an auction listing from your marketplace contract.

examples.javascript: const { data: auctionWinner, isLoading, error } = useAuctionWinner(<YourMarketplaceContractInstance>, <listingId>);

name: useBidBuffer
summary: Use this to get the buffer in basis points between offers from your marketplace contract.

examples.javascript: const { data: auctionWinner, isLoading, error } = useBidBuffer(<YourMarketplaceContractInstance>);

name: useBuyNow
summary: Use this to buy out an auction listing from your marketplace contract.

name: useCancelListing
summary: Use this to cancel a listing on your marketplace contract.

name: useChainId
summary:
Hook for accessing the chain ID of the network the current wallet is connected to
```javascript
import { useChainId } from "@web3sdks/react"
```

name: useCoinbaseWallet
summary:
Hook for connecting to a Coinbase wallet.
```javascript
import { useCoinbaseWallet } from "@web3sdks/react"
```

name: useContract
summary: Use this resolve a contract address to a smart contract instance.

examples.javascript: const { contract, isLoading, error } = useContract("{{contract_address}}");

name: useContract
summary: Use this resolve a contract address to a smart contract instance.

examples.javascript: const { contract, isLoading, error } = useContract("{{contract_address}}", "nft-drop");

name: useContract
summary: Use this resolve a contract address to a smart contract instance.

examples.javascript: const { contract, isLoading, error } = useContract("{{contract_address}}", ABI);

name: useContractRead
summary: Use this to get data from a contract read-function call.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract("{{contract_address}}");
const { data, isLoading, error } = useContractRead(contract, "functionName", ...args);

name: useContractWrite
summary: Use this to get a function to make a write call to your contract

name: useCreateAuctionListing
summary: Use this to create a new Auction Listing on your marketplace contract.

name: useCreateDirectListing
summary: Use this to create a new Direct Listing on your marketplace contract.

name: useDisconnect
summary:
Hook for disconnecting the currently connected wallet
```javascript
import { useDisconnect } from "@web3sdks/react"
```

name: useEdition
summary: Hook for getting an instance of an `Edition` contract. This contract is used to interface with ERC1155 compliant NFTs.

name: useEditionDrop
summary: Hook for getting an instance of an `EditionDrop` contract. This conract is used to interface with ERC1155 compliant NFTs that can be lazily minted.

name: useExecuteAuctionSale
summary: Execute an auction sale. Can only be executed once the auction has ended and the auction has a winning bid.

name: useListing
summary: Use this to get a specific listing from the marketplace.

examples.javascript: const { data: listing, isLoading, error } = useListing(<YourMarketplaceContractInstance>, <listingId>);

name: useListings
summary: Use this to get a list all listings from your marketplace contract.

examples.javascript: const { data: listings, isLoading, error } = useListings(<YourMarketplaceContractInstance>, { start: 0, count: 100 });

name: useListingsCount
summary: Use this to get a count of all listings on your marketplace contract.

examples.javascript: const { data: listings, isLoading, error } = useListings(<YourMarketplaceContractInstance>);

name: useMakeBid
summary: Use this to place a bid on an auction listing from your marketplace contract.

name: useMakeOffer
summary: Use this to make an offer on direct or auction listing from your marketplace contract.

name: useMarketplace
summary: Hook for getting an instance of a `Marketplace` contract. This contract is used to support marketplace for purchase and sale of on-chain assets.

name: useMetamask
summary:
Hook for connecting to a Metamask wallet.
```javascript
import { useMetamask } from "@web3sdks/react"
```

name: useMinimumNextBid
summary: Use this to get the minimum next bid for the auction listing from your marketplace contract.

examples.javascript: const { data: minimumNextBid, isLoading, error } = useMinimumNextBid(<YourMarketplaceContractInstance>, <listingId>);

name: useMultiwrap
summary: Hook for getting an instance of an `Multiwrap` contract. This contract is an ERC721 in which you can wrap ERC721, ERC1155 and ERC20 tokens.

name: useNetwork
summary: Hook for getting metadata about the network the current wallet is connected to and switching networks

name: useNetworkMismatch
summary:
Hook for checking whether the connected wallet is on the correct network specified by the `desiredChainId` passed to the `<Web3sdksProvider />`.
```javascript
import { useNetworkMistmatch } from "@web3sdks/react"
```

name: useNFTCollection
summary: Hook for getting an instance of an `NFTCollection` contract. This contract is meant to interface with ERC721 compliant NFTs.

name: useNFTDrop
summary: Hook for getting an instance of an `NFTDrop` contract. This contract is meant to interface with ERC721 compliant NFTs that can be lazily minted.

name: useOffers
summary: Get all the offers for a listing
remarks: Fetch all the offers for a specified direct or auction listing.

examples.javascript: const { data: offers, isLoading, error } = useOffers(<YourMarketplaceContractInstance>, <listingId>);

name: usePack
summary: Hook for getting an instance of a `Pack` contract. This contract supports the creation of on-chain luck-based lootboxes.

examples.javascript: const sdk = useSDK();

name: useSignatureDrop
summary: Hook for getting an instance of an `SignatureDrop` contract. This contract is meant to interface with ERC721 compliant NFTs that can be lazily minted.

name: useSplit
summary: Hook for getting an instance of a `Split` contract. This contract supports fund distribution to multiple parties.

name: useStorageUpload
summary: Hook used to upload any files or JSON data to decentralized storage systems like IPFS, using the `storageInterface` configured on the `Web3sdksProvider`

name: useToken
summary: Hook for getting an instance of a `Token` contract. This contract supports ERC20 compliant tokens.

name: useTokenDrop
summary: Hook for getting an instance of a `Token Drop` contract.

name: useVote
summary: Hook for getting an instance of an `Vote` contract. This contract enables fully featured voting-based decentralized governance systems.

name: useWalletConnect
summary:
Hook for connecting to a mobile wallet with Wallet Connect
```javascript
import { useWalletConnect } from "@web3sdks/react"
```

name: useWinningBid
summary: Use this to get a the winning bid for an auction listing from your marketplace contract.

examples.javascript: const { data: winningBid, isLoading, error } = useWinningBid(<YourMarketplaceContractInstance>, <listingId>);

ERC721ClaimableWithConditions.name: useActiveClaimCondition
ERC721ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to get the active claim condition for ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts. They need to extend the `claimCondition` extension for this hook to work.

examples.javascript: const { data: activeClaimCondition, isLoading, error } = useActiveClaimCondition(<YourERC1155ContractInstance>, <tokenId>);

ERC721ClaimableWithConditions.name: useClaimConditions
ERC721ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to get all claim conditions for ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts. They need to extend the `claimCondition` extension for this hook to work.

examples.javascript: const { data: claimConditions, isLoading, error } = useClaimConditions(<YourERC1155ContractInstance>, <tokenId>);

ERC721ClaimableWithConditions.name: useClaimerProofs
ERC721ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to get the claimer proofs for an adddress for ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts. They need to extend the `claimCondition` extension for this hook to work.

examples.javascript: const { data: claimerProofs, isLoading, error } = useClaimerProofs(<YourERC1155ContractInstance>, <tokenId>);

ERC721ClaimableWithConditions.name: useClaimIneligibilityReasons
ERC721ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to check for reasons that prevent claiming for either ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts. They need to extend the `claimCondition` extension for this hook to work.

examples.javascript: const { data: claimIneligibilityReasons, isLoading, error } = useClaimIneligibilityReasons(<YourERC1155ContractInstance>, { quantity: <quantity>, walletAddress: <walletAddress> }, <tokenId>);

ERC721ClaimableWithConditions.name: useResetClaimConditions
ERC721ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to reset claim conditions on your {@link DropContract}

ERC721ClaimableWithConditions.name: useSetClaimConditions
ERC721ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to set claim conditions on your {@link DropContract}

ERC1155ClaimableWithConditions.name: useActiveClaimCondition
ERC1155ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to get the active claim condition for ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts. They need to extend the `claimCondition` extension for this hook to work.

examples.javascript: const { data: activeClaimCondition, isLoading, error } = useActiveClaimCondition(<YourERC1155ContractInstance>, <tokenId>);

ERC1155ClaimableWithConditions.name: useClaimConditions
ERC1155ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to get all claim conditions for ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts. They need to extend the `claimCondition` extension for this hook to work.

examples.javascript: const { data: claimConditions, isLoading, error } = useClaimConditions(<YourERC1155ContractInstance>, <tokenId>);

ERC1155ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to get the claimer proofs for an adddress for ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts. They need to extend the `claimCondition` extension for this hook to work.

examples.javascript: const { data: claimerProofs, isLoading, error } = useClaimerProofs(<YourERC1155ContractInstance>, <tokenId>);

ERC1155ClaimableWithConditions.name: useClaimIneligibilityReasons
ERC1155ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to check for reasons that prevent claiming for either ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts. They need to extend the `claimCondition` extension for this hook to work.

examples.javascript: const { data: claimIneligibilityReasons, isLoading, error } = useClaimIneligibilityReasons(<YourERC1155ContractInstance>, { quantity: <quantity>, walletAddress: <walletAddress> }, <tokenId>);

ERC1155ClaimableWithConditions.name: useResetClaimConditions
ERC1155ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to reset claim conditions on your {@link DropContract}

ERC1155ClaimableWithConditions.name: useSetClaimConditions
ERC1155ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to set claim conditions on your {@link DropContract}

ERC20ClaimableWithConditions.name: useActiveClaimCondition
ERC20ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to get the active claim condition for ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts. They need to extend the `claimCondition` extension for this hook to work.

examples.javascript: const { data: activeClaimCondition, isLoading, error } = useActiveClaimCondition(<YourERC1155ContractInstance>, <tokenId>);

ERC20ClaimableWithConditions.name: useClaimConditions
ERC20ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to get all claim conditions for ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts. They need to extend the `claimCondition` extension for this hook to work.

examples.javascript: const { data: claimConditions, isLoading, error } = useClaimConditions(<YourERC1155ContractInstance>, <tokenId>);

ERC20ClaimableWithConditions.name: useClaimerProofs
ERC20ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to get the claimer proofs for an adddress for ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts. They need to extend the `claimCondition` extension for this hook to work.

examples.javascript: const { data: claimerProofs, isLoading, error } = useClaimerProofs(<YourERC1155ContractInstance>, <tokenId>);

ERC20ClaimableWithConditions.name: useClaimIneligibilityReasons
ERC20ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to check for reasons that prevent claiming for either ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts. They need to extend the `claimCondition` extension for this hook to work.

examples.javascript: const { data: claimIneligibilityReasons, isLoading, error } = useClaimIneligibilityReasons(<YourERC1155ContractInstance>, { quantity: <quantity>, walletAddress: <walletAddress> }, <tokenId>);

ERC20ClaimableWithConditions.name: useClaimToken
ERC20ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to claim tokens on your {@link Erc20}

ERC20ClaimableWithConditions.name: useResetClaimConditions
ERC20ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to reset claim conditions on your {@link DropContract}

ERC20ClaimableWithConditions.name: useSetClaimConditions
ERC20ClaimableWithConditions.summary: Use this to set claim conditions on your {@link DropContract}

ERC1155.name: useAirdropNFT
ERC1155.summary: Use this to transfer tokens on your {@link Erc1155}

ERC1155.name: useNFT
ERC1155.summary: Use this to get an individual NFT token of your {@link NFTContract}.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: nft, isLoading, error } = useNFT(contract, <tokenId>);

ERC1155.name: useNFTBalance
ERC1155.summary: Use this to get a the total balance of a {@link NFTContract} and wallet address.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: ownerBalance, isLoading, error } = useNFTBalance(contract, <OwnerWalletAddress>);

ERC1155.name: useTransferNFT
ERC1155.summary: Use this to transfer tokens on your {@link NFTContract}

PermissionsEnumerable.name: useAllRoleMembers
PermissionsEnumerable.summary: Use this to get the roles of a {@link SmartContract}

examples.javascript: const { data: roles, isLoading, error } = useAllRoleMembers(SmartContract);

PermissionsEnumerable.name: useRoleMembers
PermissionsEnumerable.summary: Use this to get the members of a role on a {@link SmartContract}

examples.javascript: const { data: members, isLoading, error } = useRoleMembers(SmartContract, "admin");

PermissionsEnumerable.name: useSetAllRoleMembers
PermissionsEnumerable.summary: Use this to OVERWRITE the list of addresses that are members of specific roles

ERC721Burnable.name: useBurnNFT
ERC721Burnable.summary: Use this to burn an NFT on your {@link Erc721OrErc1155}

ERC1155Burnable.name: useBurnNFT
ERC1155Burnable.summary: Use this to burn an NFT on your {@link Erc721OrErc1155}

ERC20Burnable.name: useBurnToken
ERC20Burnable.summary: Use this to burn tokens on your {@link Erc20} contract

ERC721LazyMintable.name: useClaimedNFTs
ERC721LazyMintable.summary: Use this to get a list of *claimed* (minted) NFT tokens of your ERC721 Drop contract.

examples.javascript: const { data: claimedNFTs, isLoading, error } = useClaimedNFTs(<YourERC721DropContractInstance>, { start: 0, count: 100 });

ERC721LazyMintable.name: useUnclaimedNFTs
ERC721LazyMintable.summary: Use this to get a list of *unclaimed* NFT tokens of your ERC721 Drop contract.

examples.javascript: const { data: unclaimedNfts, isLoading, error } = useUnclaimedNFTs(<YourERC721DropContractInstance>, { start: 0, count: 100 });

ERC1155LazyMintable.name: useClaimedNFTs
ERC1155LazyMintable.summary: Use this to get a list of *claimed* (minted) NFT tokens of your ERC721 Drop contract.

examples.javascript: const { data: claimedNFTs, isLoading, error } = useClaimedNFTs(<YourERC721DropContractInstance>, { start: 0, count: 100 });

ERC1155LazyMintable.name: useUnclaimedNFTs
ERC1155LazyMintable.summary: Use this to get a list of *unclaimed* NFT tokens of your ERC721 Drop contract.

examples.javascript: const { data: unclaimedNfts, isLoading, error } = useUnclaimedNFTs(<YourERC721DropContractInstance>, { start: 0, count: 100 });

ERC721Claimable.name: useClaimNFT
ERC721Claimable.summary: Use this to claim a NFT on your {@link DropContract}

ERC1155Claimable.name: useClaimNFT
ERC1155Claimable.summary: Use this to claim a NFT on your {@link DropContract}

ContractMetadata.name: useContractMetadata
ContractMetadata.summary: Use this to get the contract metadata for a (built-in or custom) contract.

examples.javascript: const { data: contractMetadata, isLoading, error } = useContractMetadata(>);

ContractMetadata.name: useMetadata
ContractMetadata.summary: Use this to get the metadata of your {@link SmartContract}

examples.javascript: const { data: metadata, isLoading, error } = useMetadata(SmartContract);

ContractMetadata.name: useUpdateMetadata
ContractMetadata.summary: Use this to update the metadata of your {@link SmartContract}

Permissions.name: useGrantRole
Permissions.summary: Use this to grant a {@link WalletAddress} a specific role on a {@link SmartContract}

Permissions.name: useIsAddressRole
Permissions.summary: Use this to check if a {@link WalletAddress} is a member of a role on a {@link SmartContract}

examples.javascript: const { data: isMember, isLoading, error } = useIsAddressRole(SmartContract, "admin", "0x123");

Permissions.name: useRevokeRole
Permissions.summary: Use this to revoke a {@link WalletAddress} a specific role on a {@link SmartContract}

ERC721Mintable.name: useMintNFT
ERC721Mintable.summary: Use this to mint a new NFT on your {@link Erc721OrErc1155}

ERC1155Mintable.name: useMintNFT
ERC1155Mintable.summary: Use this to mint a new NFT on your {@link Erc721OrErc1155}

ERC1155Mintable.name: useMintNFTSupply
ERC1155Mintable.summary: Use this to mint a new NFT on your {@link Erc1155}

ERC20Mintable.name: useMintToken
ERC20Mintable.summary: Use this to mint new tokens on your {@link Erc20} contract

ERC721.name: useNFT
ERC721.summary: Use this to get an individual NFT token of your {@link NFTContract}.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: nft, isLoading, error } = useNFT(contract, <tokenId>);

ERC721.name: useNFTBalance
ERC721.summary: Use this to get a the total balance of a {@link NFTContract} and wallet address.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: ownerBalance, isLoading, error } = useNFTBalance(contract, <OwnerWalletAddress>);

ERC721.name: useTransferNFT
ERC721.summary: Use this to transfer tokens on your {@link NFTContract}

ERC721Supply.name: useNFTs
ERC721Supply.summary: Use this to get a list of NFT tokens of your {@link NFTContract}.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: nfts, isLoading, error } = useNFTs(contract, { start: 0, count: 100 });

ERC721Supply.name: useTotalCirculatingSupply
ERC721Supply.summary: Use this to get a the total (minted) supply of your {@link NFTContract}.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: totalCirculatingSupply, isLoading, error } = useTotalCirculatingSupply(contract);

ERC721Supply.name: useTotalCount
ERC721Supply.summary: Use this to get the total count of NFT tokens of your {@link NFTContract}.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: count, isLoading, error } = useTotalCount(contract);

ERC1155Enumerable.name: useNFTs
ERC1155Enumerable.summary: Use this to get a list of NFT tokens of your {@link NFTContract}.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: nfts, isLoading, error } = useNFTs(contract, { start: 0, count: 100 });

ERC1155Enumerable.name: useOwnedNFTs
ERC1155Enumerable.summary: Use this to get a the owned NFTs for a specific {@link Erc721OrErc1155} and wallet address.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: ownedNFTs, isLoading, error } = useOwnedNFTs(contract, <OwnerWalletAddress>);

ERC1155Enumerable.name: useTotalCirculatingSupply
ERC1155Enumerable.summary: Use this to get a the total (minted) supply of your {@link NFTContract}.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: totalCirculatingSupply, isLoading, error } = useTotalCirculatingSupply(contract);

ERC1155Enumerable.name: useTotalCount
ERC1155Enumerable.summary: Use this to get the total count of NFT tokens of your {@link NFTContract}.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: count, isLoading, error } = useTotalCount(contract);

ERC721Enumerable.name: useOwnedNFTs
ERC721Enumerable.summary: Use this to get a the owned NFTs for a specific {@link Erc721OrErc1155} and wallet address.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: ownedNFTs, isLoading, error } = useOwnedNFTs(contract, <OwnerWalletAddress>);

PlatformFee.name: usePlatformFees
PlatformFee.summary: Use this to get the platform fees settings of your {@link SmartContract}

examples.javascript: const { data: platformFees, isLoading, error } = usePlatformFees(SmartContract);

PlatformFee.name: useUpdatePlatformFees
PlatformFee.summary: Use this to update the platform fees settings of your {@link SmartContract}

examples.javascript: const { data: recipient, isLoading, error } = usePrimarySalesRecipient(SmartContract);

PrimarySale.name: useUpdatePrimarySaleRecipient
PrimarySale.summary: Use this to update the primary sales recipient of your {@link SmartContract}

Royalty.name: useRoyaltySettings
Royalty.summary: Use this to get the royalty settings of your {@link SmartContract}

examples.javascript: const { data: settings, isLoading, error } = useRoyaltySettings(SmartContract);

Royalty.name: useUpdateRoyaltySettings
Royalty.summary: Use this to update the royalty settings of your {@link SmartContract}

ERC20.name: useTokenBalance
ERC20.summary: Use this to get the balance of your {@link Erc20} contract for a given address.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: balance, isLoading, error } = useTokenBalance(contract);

ERC20.name: useTokenDecimals
ERC20.summary: Use this to get the decimals of your {@link Erc20} contract for a given address.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: decimals, isLoading, error } = useTokenDecimals(contract);

ERC20.name: useTokenSupply
ERC20.summary: Use this to get a the total supply of your {@link Erc20} contract.

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract(<ContractAddress>);
const { data: totalSupply, isLoading, error } = useTokenSupply(contract);

ERC20.name: useTransferBatchToken
ERC20.summary: Use this to transfer batch tokens on your {@link Erc20} contract

ERC20.name: useTransferToken
ERC20.summary: Use this to transfer tokens on your {@link Erc20} contract
